name: The AI Client Attraction Podcast: Organic Marketing & AI Tools for Coaches & Creatives
host: Talena Bacon - Business Strategy Coach For Women Coaches and Creatives
description: Welcome to The AI Client Attraction Podcast — the go-to space for women coaches and creatives who want to grow their businesses with organic marketing and simple AI tools.If you're ready to attract clients, create consistent content, and show up online without the stress or burnout, you're in the right place.Inside each episode, we’ll explore what it really takes to build a sustainable business — from magnetic messaging and visibility strategies to using AI to make your content creation easier a

recent_episodes.title: Ep 20: How to Attract Clients Without Burning Yourself Out
recent_episodes.description:
Let’s be honest for a second — attracting clients doesn’t need to feel exhausting or overwhelming. In this episode, I will be talking about a simpler, more sustainable way to grow your business without being everywhere, chasing trends, or creating content nonstop. If marketing has started to feel heavy, this conversation is going to feel like a deep exhale.


I’m breaking down how organic marketing and AI can work together to help you get clear on your message, show up consiste

recent_episodes.title: Ep 19: Behind the Scenes: Why I Rebranded & What’s Next
recent_episodes.description:
Welcome back, my unstoppable coaches and creatives! In this special episode, I’m sharing why I changed the name of this podcast and what this new direction means for you and your business in 2026.

Queens Rise to CEO is now officially The AI Client Attraction Podcast and while the name has changed, the heart behind it hasn’t. I’m still here to help you simplify your marketing, attract aligned clients, and grow your business in a way that feels good and actually works.

recent_episodes.title: Ep 18: Is Your Social Media Bio Costing You Clients? Try This ChatGPT Shortcut
recent_episodes.description:
Your social media bio might seem like the tiniest detail in your business, but here’s the truth: it can make or break whether someone sticks around long enough to become a client. Think of your bio as a handshake before the conversation — it tells people who you are, what you do, and why they should care in just a few words. If your bio is vague, stiff, or doesn’t sound like you, you could be losing potential clients without even realizing it.
